etymologies: early 19th century: from French, from Latin amphibolus ‘ambiguous’ (because of the varied structure of these minerals), from Greek amphibolos, from amphi- ‘both, on both sides’ + ballein ‘to throw’

definitions: any of a class of rock-forming silicate or aluminosilicate minerals typically occurring as fibrous or columnar crystals

examples.text: acid rocks consist mostly of quartz and feldspars, with a little mica or amphibole

shortDefinitions: any of class of rock-forming silicate or aluminosilicate minerals
